title: The impact of non-genetic and genetic factors on a stable warfarin dose in Thai patients
summary: This study aimed to explore the influences of both genetic and non-genetic factors on the variability of stable warfarin doses among 250 Thai patients. Results indicated that genetic polymorphisms in VKORC1 (-1639G > A) and CYP2C9*3 significantly impacted warfarin dosing, with variant carriers needing lower doses. In contrast, neither CYP4F2 rs2108622 nor UGT1A1 rs887829 showed significant effects on dosing. Overall, 51.3% of dose variability was explained by a combination of genetic factors and non-genetic factors, such as age and body mass index.

study_parameters.Characteristics: Thai patients with stable warfarin doses

var_drug_ann.Notes: Patients with variant genotypes of VKORC1 − 1639G > A required significantly lower warfarin stable weekly doses (SWDs) than those with wild-type genotype (p < 0.001). Similarly, the patients with CYP2C9*3 variant allele required significantly lower warfarin SWDs than those with homozygous wild-type (p = 0.006).
var_drug_ann.Sentence: VKORC1 − 1639G > A, CYP2C9*3 is associated with decreased dosage of warfarin in Thai patients.
Citations: The patients with variant genotypes of VKORC1 − 1639G > A required significantly lower warfarin stable weekly doses (SWDs) than those with wild-type genotype (p < 0.001).
Similarly, the patients with CYP2C9*3 variant allele required significantly lower warfarin SWDs than those with homozygous wild-type (p = 0.006).

VKORC1 − 1639G > A, CYP2C9*3, and CYP4F2 rs2108622 polymorphisms together with age, body mass index, antiplatelet drug use, amiodarone use, and current smoker status explained 51.3% of individual variability in stable warfarin doses.

var_drug_ann.Notes: There were no significant differences in the SWDs between the patients who carried variant alleles of CYP4F2 rs2108622 and wild-type allele carriers (p=0.172). Multivariate analysis showed that CYP4F2 rs2108622 TT genotype accounted for a modest part of warfarin dose variability (1.2%).
var_drug_ann.Sentence: CYP4F2 rs2108622 is not associated with dosage of warfarin in Thai patients.
Citations: In contrast, there were no significant differences in the SWDs between the patients who carried variant alleles of CYP4F2 rs2108622 and wild-type allele carriers (p=0.172).
Multivariate analysis, however, showed that CYP4F2 rs2108622 TT genotype accounted for a modest part of warfarin dose variability (1.2%).
...these results showed that the CYP4F2 gene also contributed to warfarin dose requirements in Thais at a modest level...

var_drug_ann.Notes: The UGT1A1 rs887829 polymorphism did not contribute to dose variability.
var_drug_ann.Sentence: UGT1A1 rs887829 is not associated with dosage of warfarin in Thai patients.
Citations: In contrast, there were no significant differences in the SWDs between the patients who carried variant alleles of CYP4F2 rs2108622 and UGT1A1 rs887829 as compared to wild-type allele carriers.
In contrast, the UGT1A1 rs887829 polymorphism did not contribute to dose variability.

var_pheno_ann.Notes: Patients with variant genotypes required significantly lower warfarin doses (p < 0.001).
var_pheno_ann.Sentence: VKORC1 − 1639G > A is associated with decreased stable weekly doses of warfarin in Thai patients.
Citations: The patients with variant genotypes of VKORC1 − 1639G > A required significantly lower warfarin stable weekly doses (SWDs) than those with wild-type genotype (p < 0.001).
Patients with AA and GA genotypes of VKORC1 − 1639G > A required 49.7% and 27.7% significantly lower averages of SWDS of warfarin as compared with those with wild-type GG genotype (p < 0.001).
The warfarin SWDs were decreased by 9.7 mg and 18.1 mg in the patients with GA and AA genotypes of VKORC1 − 1639G > A as compared with those with wild-type GG genotype (p < 0.001).

var_pheno_ann.Notes: Patients with the CYP2C9*3 variant allele required significantly lower warfarin doses (p = 0.006).
var_pheno_ann.Sentence: CYP2C9*3 is associated with decreased stable weekly doses of warfarin in Thai patients.
Citations: Similarly, the patients with *CYP2C9*3 variant allele required significantly lower warfarin SWDs than those with homozygous wild-type (*p* = 0.006).
The averages of warfarin SWDs were 64.6% and 34.1% lower in *CYP2C9 *3/*3* and **1/*3* patients than in **1/*1* patients (*p* = 0.006).
The present study showed that the *CYP2C9*3* allele could explain about 6.0% of the warfarin dose variance (3.3% from *CYP2C9*3/*3* and 2.7% from *CYP2C9*1/*3*) (Table [3](#Tab3)).

var_pheno_ann.Notes: No significant differences in the stable weekly doses of warfarin were observed among variant genotypes of CYP4F2 (p = 0.172).
var_pheno_ann.Sentence: CYP4F2 rs2108622 is not associated with stable weekly doses of warfarin in Thai patients.
Citations: In contrast, there were no significant differences in the SWDs between the patients who carried variant alleles of CYP4F2 rs2108622 and UGT1A1 rs887829 as compared to wild-type allele carriers.
The dosage requirement differences, however, were not observed in patients with variant genotypes of CYP4F2 rs2108622 and UGT1A1 rs887829 (p = 0.172 and p = 0.921).
Multivariate analysis, however, showed that CYP4F2 rs2108622 TT genotype accounted for a modest part of warfarin dose variability (1.2%).

var_pheno_ann.Notes: UGT1A1 rs887829 polymorphism did not contribute to dose variability (p = 0.921).
var_pheno_ann.Sentence: UGT1A1 rs887829 is not associated with stable weekly doses of warfarin in Thai patients.
Citations: In contrast, there were no significant differences in the SWDs between the patients who carried variant alleles of CYP4F2 rs2108622 and UGT1A1 rs887829 as compared to wild-type allele carriers.
In contrast, the UGT1A1 rs887829 polymorphism did not contribute to dose variability.
The dosage requirement differences, however, were not observed in patients with variant genotypes of CYP4F2 rs2108622 and UGT1A1 rs887829 (p = 0.172 and p = 0.921).

var_fa_ann.Notes: Patients with AA genotype required 49.7% lower doses than GG genotypes (p < 0.001).
var_fa_ann.Sentence: VKORC1 − 1639G > A is associated with decreased stable weekly doses of warfarin as compared to wild type GG.
Citations: The patients with variant genotypes of VKORC1 − 1639G > A required significantly lower warfarin stable weekly doses (SWDs) than those with wild-type genotype (p < 0.001).
Patients with AA and GA genotypes of VKORC1 − 1639G > A required 49.7% and 27.7% significantly lower averages of SWDS of warfarin as compared with those with wild-type GG genotype (p < 0.001).

A multiple linear regression model using the predictors including VKORC1 (−1639G > A) AA genotype showed that warfarin SWDs were decreased by 18.1 mg as compared with those with wild-type GG genotype (p < 0.001).

var_fa_ann.Notes: CYP2C9*3 variant required 64.6% lower warfarin doses than *1/*1 genotypes (p = 0.006).
var_fa_ann.Sentence: CYP2C9*3 is associated with decreased stable weekly doses of warfarin as compared to wild type *1/*1.
Citations: Similarly, the patients with CYP2C9*3 variant allele required significantly lower warfarin SWDs than those with homozygous wild-type (p = 0.006).
The averages of warfarin SWDs were 64.6% and 34.1% lower in CYP2C9 *3/*3 and *1/*3 patients than in *1/*1 patients (p = 0.006).

var_fa_ann.Notes: CYP4F2 rs2108622 did not yield significant differences in warfarin doses compared to wild type.
var_fa_ann.Sentence: CYP4F2 rs2108622 is not associated with stable weekly doses of warfarin as compared to wild type.
Citations: In contrast, there were no significant differences in the SWDs between the patients who carried variant alleles of CYP4F2 rs2108622 and UGT1A1 rs887829 as compared to wild-type allele carriers.
Multivariate analysis, however, showed that CYP4F2 rs2108622 TT genotype accounted for a modest part of warfarin dose variability (1.2%).
The dosage requirement differences, however, were not observed in patients with variant genotypes of CYP4F2 rs2108622 and UGT1A1 rs887829 (p = 0.172 and p = 0.921).

var_fa_ann.Notes: No significant effect on warfarin dose variability observed in this study.
var_fa_ann.Sentence: UGT1A1 rs887829 is not associated with stable weekly doses of warfarin as compared to wild type.
Citations: In contrast, there were no significant differences in the SWDs between the patients who carried variant alleles of CYP4F2 rs2108622 and UGT1A1 rs887829 as compared to wild-type allele carriers.
In contrast, the UGT1A1 rs887829 polymorphism did not contribute to dose variability.
The averages of warfarin SWDs were 22.0 ± 9.1 for CC, 23.0 ± 9.6 for CT, and 22.8 ± 17.3 for TT genotypes, with a p value of 0.921.
